item.title: Structure
item.dc:creator: John Mcphee
item.description: Out the back door and under the big ash was a picnic table. At the end of summer, 1966

item.title: Omission
item.dc:creator: John Mcphee
item.description: In the nineteen-fifties, the entry-level job for writers was a column called Miscellany.

item.title: Industry, Ingenuity, and Fracture: On John McPhee
item.dc:creator: Daniel Solomon
item.description: THE WORLD THE WORK of John McPhee creates appears deceptively small.

item.title: Looking for a Ship
item.dc:creator: John Mcphee
item.description: REPORTER AT LARGE about the U.S. Merchant Marine. Writer accompanied a merchant mariner named George Anderson Chase.

item.title: A Fleet of One
item.dc:creator: John Mcphee
item.description: The little four-wheelers live on risk. They endanger themselves. They endangered us. If you’re in a big truck, they’re around you like gnats.

item.title: Survival on the Bark Canoe
item.dc:creator: John Mcphee
item.description: REPORTER AT LARGE about bark canoes and Henri Vaillancourt, of Greenville, N.H., who builds them entirely by hand the way the American Indians did.

item.title: The Sporting Scene Ruidoso
item.dc:creator: John Mcphee
item.description: THE SPORTING SCENE about the 1973 All-American Futurity, a race for quarter horses held at Ruidoso Downs in New Mexico.
